note.div: The parameters for this job may be set as job arguments or order variables

note.title: E-mail address of mail recipient(s)
note.p: List of mail recipient's e-mail address, a number of e-mail addresses are separated by comma or semicolon.

note.title: E-mail address of the sender
note.p: E-mail address used for sending mail.

note.title: Name of the sender
note.p: The free-text name of the account that sends mail.

note.title: Reply address
note.p: If no replies should be accepted then typically use an e-mail address such as no-reply@example.com is used for the respective domain. Otherwise a valid mail address can be specified to receive replies.

note.title: Cc recipient(s)
note.p: E-mail address of carbon copy recipient, multiple e-mail addresses are separated by comma or semicolon.

note.title: Bcc recipient(s)
note.p: E-mail address of blind carbon copy recipient, multiple e-mail addresses are separated by comma or semicolon.

note.title: Mail Subject
note.p: The mail subject, consider to use ASCII 7bit characters.

note.title: Mail Body
note.p: The mail body specified as plain text or HTML depending on the "content_type" setting.

note.title: Content Type (text/plain, text/html)
note.p: A content type text/plain specifies plain text mail, a content type text/html specifies use of HTML mail.

note.title: Encoding of the mail (7bit, Quoted-Printable, Base64)
note.p: The character encoding of subject and body, by default ASCII 7bit is used.

note.title: Character set of the mail
note.p: By default Latin 1 (iso-8859-1) is used.

note.title: Path to attachment(s)
note.p: The path to a file to be attached, multiple files are separated by semicolons.

note.title: Content type of attachments (application/octet-stream, application/pdf, ...)
note.p: The attachment content-type typically allows binary files.

note.title: Encoding of attachments (7bit, Quoted-Printable, Base64)
note.p: Typically attached files are encoded with printable base64 characters.

note.title: Character set of attachments
note.p: By default Latin 1 (iso-8859-1) is used.

note.title: Mail server SMTP protocol (smtp, smtps)
note.p: The protocol to be used, defaults to "smtp".

note.title: Mail server host
note.p: The hostname or IP address of the SMTP server.

note.title: Mail server port
note.p: The port of the SMTP server.

note.title: SMTP user account
note.p: The user account to be used in case that the SMTP server requires authentication.

note.title: SMTP user account password
note.p: The password to be used for the user account in case that the SMTP server requires authentication.

documentation.p:
This job is used to send mail.
All "mail.*" properties for Java Mail can be used (see https://javaee.github.io/javamail/docs/api//com/sun/mail/smtp/package-summary.html).

ul.li: If "mail.smtp.user" is specified then "mail.smtp.auth" is set to "true". Otherwise "mail.smtp.auth" is set to "false".
If the security protocol is specified as "ssl" then "mail.smtp.ssl.enable" is set to "true" and "mail.transport.protocol" is set to "smtps".
If the security protocol is specified as "starttls" then "mail.smtp.starttls.enable" is set to "true" and "mail.transport.protocol" is set to "smtps".
